result.execSummary:
The defendant Brennan Jay Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 08/28/15 or civil judgment.
Huber priviledges for work, work search, and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brennan Jay Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brennan Jay Boyd in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Brennan Jay Boyd in custody.  Student Intern Morgan Wills under the supervision of  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 20 days in the House of Correction with credit of 0 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, work search, and treatment. 
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 08-28-2015 or civil judgment.

Defendant Brennan Jay Boyd in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brennan Jay Boyd in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Brennan Jay Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brennan Jay Boyd
Current: 3430 W Wisconsin Ave, #404, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 05-17-2015)
Prior: 2579 N. 50th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
